result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A. Thunder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Craig A. Thunder is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Craig A. Thunder was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Craig A. Thunder in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Craig A. Thunder in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called 9:35 am.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea to ct 1 and ct 2 to be dismissed.  Right to preliminary reviewed with def.  Def waives preliminary.  Court accepts waiver, found probable cause.  Information filed.  Waive reading.  Ct 1 - Def acknowledges previous conviction.  No contest plea entered.  Ct 2 dismissed by Court consistent with plea agreement.  Plea advisement form reviewed. Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Factual basis for plea if left unchallenged.  Court finds def understands charge, penalties and rights.  Plea accepted, found guilty.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Brief statement by def.  Court will accept plea agreement.  Sentence withheld, probation 2 1/2 years  (30 months)  Cost.  AODA counseling.     If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post conviction rights.  Part of cost will include $250.00 DNA surcharge.  Firearms and voting rights reviewed.  DNA sample if not already done.  Post conviction.  Bond to be returned to poster.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution (Copy)
Attorney Wright C Laufenberg in court.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:20 a.m. State advises of status.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
